required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability Study of Suprachoroidal Injection of CLS-AX Following Anti-VEGF Therapy in Neovascular AMD
clinical_study.official_title: OASIS: Open-label, Dose-escalation, Phase 1/2a Study of the Safety and Tolerability of Suprachoroidally Administered CLS-AX Following Intravitreal Anti-VEGF Therapy in Subjects With Neovascular Age-related Macular Degeneration

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of suprachoroidally administered CLS-AX following intravitreal anti-VEGF therapy in subjects with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD)

detailed_description.textblock: Multi-center, open-label, dose-escalation, phase 1/2a, safety and tolerability study to evaluate three dose groups of suprachoroidally administered CLS-AX following intravitreal anti-VEGF therapy in subjects with neovascular age-related macular degeneration

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three groups of approximately 5 participants are assigned to receive interventions in sequential dose escalation fashion based on prior milestones being reached.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) and serious adverse events
primary_outcome.description: The summary of adverse events and serious adverse events will be based on the Safety Population and will be limited to TEAEs. A TEAE is any adverse event occurring on or after the date and time of the SC injection of CLS-AX administration at Baseline (Visit 2) or worsening relative to the pre CLS-AX state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pre injection Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from Baseline (Visit 2) pre injection IOP values in the study eye

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of subjects receiving additional intravitreal (IVT) aflibercept injections
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects receiving additional intravitreal injections during the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of subjects qualifying to receive additional intravitreal (IVT) aflibercept injections
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects qualifying to receive additional intravitreal injections during the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline (Visit 2) in central subfield retinal thickness (CST) in the study eye
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from Baseline (Visit 2) values in CST during the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline (Visit 2) in best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) letter score in the study eye
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from Baseline (Visit 2) values in BCVA during the course of the study.
Maximum (or peak) plasma concentration of axitinib during the course of the study

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive a low dose of 0.03 mg CLS-AX
Subjects will receive a middle dose of 0.10 mg CLS-AX
Subjects will receive a high dose of 0.30 mg CLS-AX

intervention.description: injectable suspension of small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI)
Standard of care therapy used to block vascular endothelial growth factor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of neovascular age-related macular degeneration in the study eye.
- Active subfoveal choroidal neovascularization (CNV) secondary to AMD
- Two or more prior anti-VEGF intravitreal injections
- EDTRS BCVA score ≤ 75 and ≥ 20 letters
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any active ocular disease, ocular disorders or conditions, prior ocular surgery or infection in the study eye other than nAMD
- Other than IVT anti-VEGF treatments, no topical ocular or intraocular or periocular corticosteroid, or other treatments for CNV
- IOP ≥ 25mmHg or cup-to-disc ratio >0.8
- Uncontrolled systemic disease (high risk or evidence of arterial and venous thromboembolism, CVA or stroke, unstable cardiovascular disease, uncontrolled hyperthyroidism, poor glycemic control, gastrointestinal bleed and/or high risk of GI perforation or fistula formation) or any other condition or therapy that would make the participant unsuitable for the study
- Currently enrolled in an investigational drug or device study or has used an investigational drug or device within 30 days or the Screening visit

facility.name: Northern California Retina Vitreous Associates Medical Group, LLC
